snippet: A prominent Burmese monk who was released from prison last month was arrested again Friday in Yangon, according to a group that tracks political prisoners.
abstract: Prominent Burmese monk Ashin Gambira, who was freed in January as part of a mass release of political prisoners, is detained again, which appears to demonstrate the limits of tolerance under Myanmar's new civilian government.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A prominent Burmese monk who was released from prison last month was arrested again Friday in Yangon, according to a group that tracks political prisoners.

headline.seo: Myanmar Arrests Monk Freed From Prison in January
headline.main: Myanmar Detains Monk Recently Freed From Prison
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Detains Monk Recently Freed From Prison
